info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 6:18PM EDT until July 29 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Henderson County in western North Carolina... Southwestern Polk County in western North Carolina... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 618 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hendersonville, or over Laurel Park, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda, Valley Hill, Horse Shoe, Tuxedo and Crab Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
